title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 16 ยง 651.16 - Retention of telephone toll records
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 16 ยง 651.16 - Retention of telephone toll records

State Regulations

Each company that offers or bills toll telephone service
shall retain for a period of 18 months such records as are necessary to provide
the following billing information about telephone toll calls: the name, address, and telephone number of the caller, telephone number called, date, time, length of call, method of completion of call (e.g., direct dial, operator
assisted, third number or calling card) and automatic message accounting tapes. Each company shall retain this information for toll calls that it bills whether
it is billing its own toll service customers for toll calls or billing
customers for another company. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 16
ยง
651.16

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
